turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Well, to-- new friends.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: And more...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Nothing.  Prices are a little steep here, aren't they?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  You're my guest.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What looks good?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Hmmmm... Well, the scampi sounds good...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You like shrimp?  I like shrimp.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: So what do you think?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Uh, the scampi sounds good to me, too.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Faith, this is my mother.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh, hello.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Mommy, this is Faith.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So, you say you've been to Italy before?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: A few times.  It's kind of an annual tradi--

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: So, what are we waiting for?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Let's face it.  You want me.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I don't know, I guess I never really thought about it...  Is Larry here?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yeah.  He's around somewhere.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't believe in statistics.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You're an accountant for cryin' out loud.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What about that guy you work with, Mike what's-his-name?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No.  He smokes.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How about the other one?  His friend.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Just moved in with his girlfriend.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How about that guy at the bank?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Scientologist.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So, you gotta be a little flexible. Look at your brother and me. Larry's not perfect, neither am I.  But we work it out.  We're not unrealistic in our expectations, and we have each other.  I think you've got the Door Number Three Syndrome.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Don't tell me, Oprah did a show--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't have an Amana freezer.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It's a metaphor.  It's women who always think there's some unknown out there that's going to be better than what's in front of them.  And instead wind up with nothing.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Metaphorically, I still don't have an Amana freezer.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I think if you're honest with yourself, you'll admit you've had a chance at a number of Amana appliances in your lifetime.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Is everything okay?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yes.  You know all the shrinks on Donahue say that all those love songs about some enchanted evening are just a cruel hoax that feeds people's fantasies.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: But somebody wrote those songs.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So, what's your point?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Just that they came out of somebody's experience is all.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No, Faith.  They came out of somebody's imagination.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I wish you didn't have to go so early.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah, well, Larry and his friends are hungry.  And I did say I'd try to pick something up.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Is he married?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Is he gay?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't know.  I don't think so.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So, he's not my type.  Let me walk you to the elevator.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What's he do?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't know, Kate.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You don't have any idea?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He's a podiatrist or something.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: "Thrills"?  That's what you're waiting for?  You know how long that lasts?  Besides, how do you know?  Have you ever been out with him?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No.  He's never asked me.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Why don't you ask him?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Why should I ask someone out who I don't want to go out with in the first place?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: If you've never been out with him, how do you know you don't want to go out with him?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He begged me to marry him.  I didn't even want to marry him.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yes you did.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well, I wouldn't've if I hadn't thought I was in love.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Come on, it's not so bad.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Look how big it makes me look.  I look like an Alp.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I think it was sweet of him to pick it out.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I know...  It was.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: But what?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh, I don't know.  I guess it's just not quite the way I always thought it was going to be.  You know, like in the movies.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: That's the problem.  When you're a kid you think life is gonna be like the movies.  Dreams come true, the good guys win, people live happily ever after... all that crap.  Turn.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: But one day you wake up and realize you've been had.  Of course life isn't like the movies.  That's why there are movies.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yeah.  I guess you're right.  I really like the wallpaper we picked out for the den.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Let me tell you something about love.  There are no prince charmings, there are no glass slippers.  Love is hard work.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I know.  You're right.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: People have problems, insecurities, flaws-- and you have to learn to compromise, to overlook, to forgive.  It's not settling, Faith, it's life.  Real life.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I understand, Kate.  What do you think of this garter?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I mean, just how long are you going to cling to this childish illusion that it's all supposed to be perfect?  Well, guess what?... It isn't.  Not for you, not for anybody.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Kate, is something the matter?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Larry brought me flowers last night.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Is that bad?...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I think he's having an affair.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Have you seen him with someone?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No...  I can just tell.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: After all, he is my brother, and I know he can be kind of a jerk sometimes, but I know him pretty well, and I really don't think--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: It's a miracle.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It's a coincidence.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: The woman at my dry cleaners believes there's no such thing as coincidence.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: It was my New Year's resolution to overcome it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: But it's July.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: It's still the new year...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What about your job?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I have vacation time coming to me.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You don't have a passport.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: That's where you're wrong.  I got one nine years ago.  I just never had an opportunity to use it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Because you were afraid to fly.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Would you stop saying that?  I need you to do me a really big favor.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Does Dwayne know about this?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Of course not.  I told him I was going to visit a great aunt.  And don't tell Larry, either.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I can't believe we did this.  Do I have to remind you that your wedding is in six days?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Look, I know you think this is irresponsible of me, but think how much more irresponsible it would be to marry the wrong person.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No, I haven't.  And you forgot about the fortune teller.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: My God, you have...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Thank you so much.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You're just going to fly to Italy and start combing the streets?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He was on his way to Venice, right? I called the tourist bureau and I must've called every hotel in the city, but I found where he's staying.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: A foreign land full of millions of Italian men...  speaking Italian with Italian accents and those huge brown eyes and that silky olive skin...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: How hard can it be?  I'll land there, I'll go to his hotel, I'll introduce myself, and--

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Live happily ever after.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I keep it in the glove compartment in case of emergencies.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You're coming with me?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Sure.  I'm fine.  I don't know why I never did this before.  I mean, what's the big deal?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Now what do we do?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: The book said they have boats that are like taxis...  Vaporettos.  What's the name of the place we're staying again?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: It's called... the Gritty Palace.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: "Gritty"?  Is this gonna be one of those youth hostel dives jammed with backpackers who don't believe in deodorant?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't know...  Maybe.  Think of it as an adventure.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: This is a Lifestyles hotel.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: "Of the Rich and Famous".  Of which we are neither.  Are you out of your mind?  We can't afford this.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yes.  Cathy Lee Crosby stayed here.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Well, we're here.  And more importantly, he's here.  We'll cut back on everything else.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I can't believe we came all this way and he's gone.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You gave it your best shot.  You tried.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: We lost him?...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I'll never meet the man of my dreams.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You and the other 99% of the women in the world.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Just once more, so you'll be sure to know what to look for.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Faith, I've seen it already, okay? If I spot somebody who's got a head that's an eighth of an inch around, standing underneath a tuba, I'll recognize him from the photo. Otherwise, I'm telling you, it's not gonna do me any good.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He fell out.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You can't really blame him for being upset.  It was an Armani suit.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Did I or did I not offer to have it cleaned?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I don't think he understood what you were saying.  What's the airport number?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I just got a dial tone--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: The guy at the desk said he only left about a half hour ago, right?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So, maybe his room hasn't been cleaned yet.  Maybe there's something in there that might help us.  Maybe they'll let us go in and take a look around.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Ah ha!...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What'd you find?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: A Butterfinger wrapper.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: A rich, possibly fat, slob.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Maybe there's fingerprints on it?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: We're not looking to arrest the man, Faith, we're trying to locate him.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh.  Right.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: We're saved!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: A phone message.  Only--

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Only what?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Only, it's in Italian...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Your brother?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What was I gonna do?  Tell him the truth?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Couldn't we just have taken a train?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: The book said they have a lot of rail strikes in Italy.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I told you a liter was less than a gallon.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: We would've had enough gas to get us there if you hadn't gotten us lost.  Besides, a kilometer is less than a mile.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Right.  So we should've been able to cover more of them.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I'm hungry.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You know, no offense or anything Kate, but I think I'm starting to see Larry's side of the story.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You expecting somebody you know?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well, you don't have to get snippy with me.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So, what exactly is Larry's side of the story, anyway?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't know, Kate.  I just said that.  I'm sorry.  I'm just on edge.  I'm afraid we're losing him.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You think he misses me at all?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: 'Course he does.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You know, when Larry and I got married, I thought we were so lucky we found each other so early. People talk about spending their lives together, how many of them really get to?  But maybe I was wrong.  Maybe sooner or later everything wears out.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: That was a long time ago.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: And you know what I thought then, Kate?  I thought, I hope someday I have somebody who loves me that much.  I still hope that.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He went out and bought himself men's cologne the other day.  Did I tell you that?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Larry bought himself cologne?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Polo.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Anna, I'm Faith.  You don't know how happy I am to meet you.  You see, I'm trying to find someone, and--

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Her brother.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Right.  My brother.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What did you say to her?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't know.  I just asked her if she knew him and all of the sudden--

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What's she saying?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: All of the sudden, I'm feeling kind of nervous.  God, I hate blind dates.  Why couldn't we just have arranged marriages in America?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You're right.  At least that way you could spend the rest of your life blaming your parents instead of yourself.  Smile.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I sort of wanted to wait to see if maybe he'd notice me first?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You've travelled over six thousand miles and now you're gonna play hard to get?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So what's in a name?  I wanna join him.  I don't see why we can't join him.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I told you.  If he sees me here with another guy, he's gonna think I'm here with another guy.  I just don't want to send any confusing signals.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well, how come we're always looking for guys for you?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Because I'm the one who's single.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I never even got to be single.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Sure you did.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Not if you don't count the sixth grade.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Okay, okay.  You join him.  But first will you ask if he's here?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He's heeeeeerrre...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh my God.  Where?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He's sitting in the fourth booth down, on the left hand side, with his back to us.  He's wearing a navy jacket.  If you turn around, you can see part of his right elbow.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Is he looking at us?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Right, right...  Okay..  You don't think he's gonna think I'm too aggressive?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Faith.  So far you've trailed the man halfway around the globe.  At this point, I don't think another fifteen feet is gonna tip the scales.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Right.  Okay...  It's meant to be right?  This is it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Faith--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well, nobody can say we didn't try.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Okay, here's what I think.  We find out what all the subway stops for that train are-- the subway system's really not that big in Rome, we could narrow it down and--

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: And then what, Faith?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: And then... we rent a truck, or a car, either one, and we set up a loudspeaker, and we drive through the surrounding areas, and we page him.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: That was really sweet...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I meant about my idea.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I think it's time we got some professional help.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Like a detective.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No... Like a psychiatrist.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Don't be silly.  How's a psychiatrist gonna find him?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah.  Sociopaths.  They're able to figure out what you want them to be and then they act like that.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: But how could he know?  He only just met me.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Men have ways.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Hi-iii...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Hi.  Where've you been?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Sightseeing...  What're you doing?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Packing.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Because I've been kidding myself. Because I realized you were right from the beginning.  This whole thing was just a wild goose chase.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So, you've had a little bad luck.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: A little bad luck?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Okay, a lot of bad luck.  But that means the odds are probably in your favor now.  This is no time to give up.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Why do they read kids fairy tales in the first place?  Children are very impressionable, you know.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So you're just quitting?  Just like that?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I thought you were the one who didn't think I should've come in the first place.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I know, but...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: It was a ouija board, remember?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: ...and a fortune teller.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yeah, well, obviously it wasn't meant to be.  I've got forty-eight hours.  I can still make it home in time to marry Dwayne and try to forget any of this ever happened.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What about Peter?...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Peter?  Peter was a mistake.  An imposter.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: The last dead end in a long series of dead ends that I am relieved to finally be leaving behind.  May as well start packing, our cab's gonna be here in an hour.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Who said I was going?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I'm just not ready to go home quite yet, that's all.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No.  No, you go ahead.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You sure you'll be okay?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I'm sure.  And Kate, thank you for coming.  Thank you for being such a good friend.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I'll be back before you leave.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Peter found him?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yes.  Isn't that amazing?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Amazing...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He's down in someplace called Positano.  Peter says we can make it there by morning.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Joan Collins stayed here.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Is Damon Bradley here?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Whatareyoudoing?!

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What if he doesn't like me?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It means you're a completely worthless excuse for a human being, and the fates have all conspired to make you miserable.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: My God... you're right.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Faith, I'm kidding.  Is this how you plan to get what you want from life?  When you finally find it, you turn and run away from it?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Kate.  Thank God you're there. I need help.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Uh huh...  Okay, we'll be there. How is he, anyway?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Not only is he a momma's boy and a fascist, he says "nuculear" and "irregardless".

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No one's perfect, Kate.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: And he is living proof.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No, I think maybe you've been right.  I think I may have been too critical in the past.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Maybe I can change him.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I thought this was supposed to be the one guy in the world you wouldn't need to change.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Maybe if I kiss him I'll feel it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Or maybe it'll turn him back into a toad.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He's a jerk.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yes.  He is.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I spent my whole life waiting for a creep.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I came all the way to Italy in search of a weasel.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: When you could've found one in America.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So.  I guess I've got a wedding to go to.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Kate is that you?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I didn't expect you back so soon.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well, I realized, if you're getting married, you're gonna be needing the maid of honor, right?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Actually, no.  There's not going to be a wedding.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well... I ought to be getting home anyway.  The kids'll be back from camp soon.  The house is probably a mess.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: And Larry?...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What about Larry?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't know.  I've just been thinking... maybe this destiny thing is more of a do-it-yourself operation.  Maybe the things that are meant to be are the things we want badly enough to fight for.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I'm fine.  Have you seen Peter?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He's gone.  He told me what happened.  He just left for the airport.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Larry, did you rent a car?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: And you are?...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Kate.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: You are looking for a place to stay, no, Kate?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No.  Well, I don't know.  Well, maybe.  Later.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: This is your most lucky day.  My family runs a pension not three blocks from here.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: My friend is looking for her brother and she thinks this woman knows where he is.  Can you tell us what she's saying?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: She's saying he's a-- a--  porco.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: A porco?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: A pig!  A pig!  She's saying he's a pig.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Giovanni, this is Faith's friend, Peter.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Oh, hello.  I just came by to see if you wanted to join me for a drink, but--

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I'd love to.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: It's siesta.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: You see, in America they care for work, they live to work.  But in Italy, they care for food, for love, for pleasure...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How old are you?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: What do the years matter?  I've known you for centuries...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Giovanni, I want to thank you.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: I thank you.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No, you don't understand.  It's been wonderful meeting you.  But... I have a husband.  I have two kids at camp.  I have a life I have to go back to.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: You don't have to go if you don't want to...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: But I do want to.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: You think I'm just one of those Italian Casanovas.  The guys who try to seduce every woman who comes their way.  Who prey on unhappily married women.  Who lure unsuspecting--

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Giovanni.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: That's exactly what you are.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Kate, you're still there?  I thought you'd be on your way home by now.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You miss me?...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Uh, yeah.  Sure.  Honey, did you forget the guys are coming over tonight?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No, why?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Well, there's nothing here to eat.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: This is the last one before the wedding, right?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: And we didn't have to bring another present?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Not only is it tacky, it's exploitation.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: It's not exploitation.  These people wanna sell and I wanna buy. How are golf clubs exploitation?  She takes one night class and suddenly she's a socialist.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Sociologist.  And because.  Pawn shops are just like prostitutes, farm auctions and coal miners.  They're all for sale, but none of 'em would be if they weren't desperate for the money.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: We're all desperate for the money, doll.  That's what made this country great.  Back me up on this Candy, am I right?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Don't call me doll, Larry.  I hate it when you call me doll.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: You used to love it when I called you doll.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You said it differently then.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Damon Bradley?  That's why you're here?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What?  You know him?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: It was just a joke.  I was pushing the arrow.  I wanted to get to the next question.  I wanted to find out who was gonna win the Series.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Are you saying you just made the whole thing up?  The guy never even existed?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: He existed.  He was some kid I knew from Little League.  He was a real jerk.  You say he's a friend of Dwayne's?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Went to high school with him. But...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I thought she'd get a kick out of it.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: It was a harmless little prank. Who in the world would've thought she'd spend her life waiting for this guy?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Larry, you've got to tell her.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I can't tell her.  She's called off her wedding.  She'll never speak to me again.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I came after the woman I love.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He missed me.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Yeah--

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Faith.  Larry has something he wants to tell you about Damon Bradley.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: She what?!

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: She said she knew where to find him, and then she grabbed my car keys, and--

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: And you didn't tell her?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: She didn't give me a chance.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I have to talk to her.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: She's not here.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: She went out to check into skywriting.  I can't believe you lied.  Is this a genetic thing, men will say anything just to get laid?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No!  That's not fair.  That's not it at all.  Look, something somewhere got screwed up.  Maybe some metaphysical wires got crossed.  I may not have the right name, but I was there.  I'm the guy.  I'm-- skywriting??

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It was an emergency.  I only lied that night because it was the only way I knew to stop her.  I knew if I didn't, I'd never see her again.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Good strategy.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Do you know I wasn't even supposed to be in Rome?  My boss was supposed to come to this conference, and at the last minute he got the measles.  The measles. Who gets the measles at forty-three?  So they sent me. And I wasn't supposed to be in that piazza that night either.  I'd gone to the movies, only it was sold out.  So I was wandering around. Just wandering...  When I got hit in the head with this shoe.
